%%[created at: 2023 Dec 11 22:15:28]%%

**Description of feature/enhancement**
When copying a feedback session, user is not notified why they are unable to copy the feedback session if the session name field is empty: 
![image](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/67156011/067dadb7-7115-4c6b-97f5-11a6800ba679)


Let's append a * symbol after "Session Name", and display a red warning with an exclamation mark, stating "The field Session Name should not be empty," when the instructor clicks the field but leaves it empty, similar to #12617 

</panel>

<hr class="thick-1 border-secondary" />

<panel type="warning" popup-url="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/issues/12653" expanded>
<div slot="header">

**501 :octicon-issue-opened:** (created issue #12653: Copy course modal: Mandatory fields not highlighted)
</div>

%%[created at: 2023 Dec 11 22:21:13]%%

**Description of feature/enhancement**
When copying a course, user is not notified that the course ID and course name fields are mandatory:

![image](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/67156011/d4f54bbd-e909-4dcc-9b12-591f58a8b81f)

Unlike when creating a course:
![image](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/67156011/e5a55d05-d3ac-4b0b-8924-8867d73483f9)

Let's make the behavior consistent between the 2, by displaying a red warning with an exclamation mark, stating "The field Course ID/Course Name should not be empty," when the instructor clicks the field but leaves it empty
</panel>

%%[created at: 2024 Jan 23 16:06:54]%%

&gt;!-- Issue title: [brief description of feature/enhancement] -->

**Description of feature/enhancement**
Currently, developers need to manually create spy objects that mock a service/component:

e.g. 
<img width="352" alt="image" src="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/67156011/3d188d31-0903-4ab6-bb6c-2fe2685d7016">

Let's create a testing utility function that automatically creates these spy objects for us

**Justification**
&gt;!-- Explain who will benefit (instructors, students, developers, etc.) and in what way. -->
This will improve the developer experience when writing tests, instead of having the developer having to repeat the mock object, they can simply call the function once to create the object for them. 

An added benefit would be that the spy object created be typed instead of `any`, and our IDEs would be able to autocomplete the method name for us whenever we are accessing the spy method of an object.



</panel>

</div>

%%[created at: 2024 Jan 23 16:19:30]%%

&gt;!-- Issue title: [brief description of feature/enhancement] -->
Entity builders for more readable tests

**Description of feature/enhancement**
Currently, we are creating entities for the purpose of testing in this manner:
<img width="347" alt="image" src="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/67156011/36adfceb-0f78-4bd1-a871-5a1a870c49e8">

This is pretty bad for readability, as there is alot of noise in the creation of the entities, making it hard to tell which details are relevant for the tests.

**Justification**
&gt;!-- Explain who will benefit (instructors, students, developers, etc.) and in what way. -->
By creating a builder for the entity, we can specify properties that are only relevant for tests, making it easier for developers to not only create entities but enhance readability of our test code as well. 
See: https://testing.googleblog.com/2023/10/include-only-relevant-details-in-tests.html


**Existing similar features and their shortcomings**
&gt;!-- Explain why existing similar features fall short of your expectation. -->
&gt;!-- This section can be skipped if there are no existing similar features. -->
A potential shortcoming would be our builder default parameters would need to be updated whenever changes to the entities occur.
</panel>

<panel type="warning" popup-url="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/issues/12859" expanded>
<div slot="header">

**507 :octicon-issue-opened:** (created issue #12859: Create test utility to test event emission)
</div>

%%[created at: 2024 Feb 29 01:54:48]%%

&gt;!-- Issue title: [brief description of feature/enhancement] -->

- **Environment**: &gt;!-- The environment in which the said feature/enhancement is absent, e.g. live server at `V8.0.0`, `master` branch at commit 1234567. -->

**Description of feature/enhancement**
According to the angular documentation, the way to test event emissions is by subscribing to it directly: 
```javascript
it('should raise selected event when clicked (triggerEventHandler)', () => ``{``
    let selectedHero: Hero | undefined;
    comp.selected.pipe(first()).subscribe((hero: Hero) => (selectedHero = hero));
    heroDe.triggerEventHandler('click'); # trigger event
    expect(selectedHero).toBe(expectedHero);
  ``}``);
```

https://angular.dev/guide/testing/components-scenarios#clicking

Let's create a testing utility that will help make it easier for developers to test event emissions

**Justification**
&gt;!-- Explain who will benefit (instructors, students, developers, etc.) and in what way. -->
This will benefit developers writing tests


</panel>

%%[created at: 2023 Oct 02 17:11:11]%%

The logic works as follows:

1. Frontend sends PUT request with `courseId` and `feedbackSessionName` as params
2. Backend searches for the feedback session in the db using the `courseId` and `feedbackSessionName`
3. If there are new students who have individual deadlines, check if all the students sent in the PUT request to update their deadlines are in the course
4. Load student emails in the course from the db using `courseId` as a filter, as the set of student emails in the course
5. Check if the emails in the update request are in set of student emails in the course

Given that the feedbacksession stores the student deadlines as a map of studentEmail to deadline, could it be the case where an existing student that has an individual deadline has their email address changed, and thus every request we make to update the deadline throws an error as that email is no longer in the course? (in sending a PUT request, the ones with existing deadlines are sent to the backend as well)
</panel>

<panel type="info" popup-url="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/issues/12594#issuecomment-1742674441" expanded>
<div slot="header">

**535 :octicon-comment:** (commented on issue #12594)
</div>

%%[created at: 2023 Oct 02 17:18:47]%%

If my hypothesis is correct, there is a quick fix:

![image](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/67156011/2a10e8ab-ee15-45ea-99e9-f2ced9998ff5)

Delete all the current individual deadlines (this would result in student deadlines being an empty set, and hence the check for `verifyAllStudentsExistInCourse` would be true), then add them all back (adds in the correct updated email, thus the check is valid and the update operation goes through)

The long term fix would probably be not to use emails for the key but instead the generated id of the student
</panel>

<panel type="warning" popup-url="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/issues/13064" expanded>
<div slot="header">

**240 :octicon-issue-opened:** (created issue #13064: Use AccountRequestUpdateRequest as parameter)
</div>

%%[created at: 2024 Apr 20 08:27:44]%%

&lt;!-- Issue title: [brief description of feature/enhancement] -->

**Environment**: `master`

**Description of feature/enhancement**

Currently the AccountRequestUpdate parameters are passed in as separate parameters (see this [link](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/blob/4682dffb71e4566ed72a9e8a7b2b814e8d16f869/src/web/services/account.service.ts#L121-L136)).

We want to change it to take in one type as the parameter, instead of passing every parameters in separately. An example of how a type is passed in to represent all parameters: [link](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/blob/4682dffb71e4566ed72a9e8a7b2b814e8d16f869/src/web/services/course.service.ts#L139-L142)

**Justification**
&lt;!-- Explain who will benefit (instructors, students, developers, etc.) and in what way. -->

This refactors the code in a more maintainable way, as developers do not need to update the function parameters every time there is a change. Instead, they can just edit the typescript type.

</panel>

<panel type="warning" popup-url="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/issues/13066" expanded>
<div slot="header">

**242 :octicon-issue-opened:** (created issue #13066: Combine Admin Add Account Request Flow into Instructor Account Request Flow)
</div>

%%[created at: 2024 Apr 20 10:27:32]%%

&lt;!-- Issue title: [brief description of feature/enhancement] -->

- **Environment**: `master`

**Description of feature/enhancement**

Before we introduced Account Request Form (#11878), admin add instructors in Admin Home Page (without the approve / reject stage) and the result is displayed as follows:

![telegram-cloud-photo-size-5-6116111692854311756-y](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/69516975/fe930e07-e8e2-4cd9-b920-a7ffd10d8b12)


With the Account Request Form, admin can see pending account request submitted by instructors in a scrollable table. (see more in #12933)
&lt;video src="https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/assets/74132255/5707ba1c-753d-4742-a06d-8a7ebafd1153">

We want to combine the admin adding instructor flow into the instructor account request flow.

This will need:
1. Combine the old Result table and the new PendingAccountRequest table
2. Integrate the Approve / Reject stage for admin added request

**Justification**
&lt;!-- Explain who will benefit (instructors, students, developers, etc.) and in what way. -->

Instead of having two separate table in admin home page for account requests added by admin and for those submitted by instructors, combining the UI into one table makes it cleaner and less confusing.


</panel>
